00062   /**************************************************************************/
00073   /**************************************************************************/
00074   int RoundFloat(float theFloat)
00075   {
00076     // Get the int value
00077     int intVal = static_cast<int>(theFloat);
00078     // Get the remainder
00079     float remainder = theFloat - static_cast<float>(intVal);
00080     // if the remainder is more than or equal to 0.5, add 1
00081     if (remainder >= 0.5f) ++intVal;
00082     // return the val
00083     return intVal;
00084   }
00085 }

00106 /**************************************************************************/
00111 /**************************************************************************/
00112 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00113 BList<T, Size>::BList() : head_(NULL), tail_(NULL), _isSorted(true), 
00114                           _stats(sizeof(BNode), 0, Size, 0){}
00115 
00116 /**************************************************************************/
00121 /**************************************************************************/
00122 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00123 BList<T, Size>::BList(const BList &rhs) : head_(NULL), tail_(NULL), 
00124                                           _isSorted(rhs._isSorted), 
00125                                           _stats(sizeof(BNode), 0, Size, 0)
00126 {
00127   // Go through each of the nodes, copying over the info
00128   // The node from the rhs
00129   BNode* rhsNode = rhs.head_;
00130   // The node before that
00131   BNode* prevNode = NULL;
00132   while (rhsNode){
00133     // Create a new node
00134     BNode* theNode = _CreateNode(NULL, prevNode);
00135     // Push in all the values
00136     for (unsigned i = 0; i < rhsNode->count; ++i) 
00137       _InsertIntoNode(theNode, theNode->count, rhsNode->values[i]);
00138     // Store the node
00139     prevNode = theNode;
00140     // Go to the next node
00141     rhsNode = rhsNode->next;
00142   }
00143 }

00155   clear();

00158 /**************************************************************************/
00169 /**************************************************************************/
00170 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00171 BList<T, Size>& BList<T, Size>::operator=(const BList& rhs)throw(BListException)
00172 {
00173   // Clear your old nodes first
00174   clear();
00175   // The node from the rhs
00176   BNode* rhsNode = rhs.head_;
00177   // The node before that
00178   BNode* prevNode = NULL;
00179   // The new node
00180   BNode* theNode;
00181   // Go through each of the nodes, copying over the info
00182   while (rhsNode){
00183     // Attempt to create a new node
00184     try {theNode = _CreateNode(NULL, prevNode);}
00185     catch (BListException& ba){
00186       // Call clear
00187       clear();
00188       // And then throw it on
00189       throw(ba);
00190     }
00191     // Push in all the values
00192     for (unsigned i = 0; i < rhsNode->count; ++i) 
00193       _InsertIntoNode(theNode, theNode->count, rhsNode->values[i]);
00194     // Store the node
00195     prevNode = theNode;
00196     // Go to the next node
00197     rhsNode = rhsNode->next;
00198   }
00199   // Return yourself
00200   return *this;
00201 }

00203 /**************************************************************************/
00212 /**************************************************************************/
00213 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00214 void BList<T, Size>::push_back(const T& value) throw(BListException)
00215 {
00216   // Welp, it ain't sorted anymore
00217   _isSorted = false;
00218   // If no tail, its an empty list, just add it in
00219   if (tail_ == NULL)
00220   {
00221     // Create the node
00222     BNode* newNode = _CreateNode();
00223     // Add in the value
00224     _InsertIntoNode(newNode, 0, value);
00225     // And just set it as the head and the tail
00226     head_ = newNode; tail_ = newNode;
00227   }
00228   // If there is a tail, see whether you can add it there
00229   else
00230   {
00231     BNode* theNode = tail_;
00232     // If it is a full node, add in a new node first
00233     if (tail_->count == Size) theNode = _CreateNode(NULL, tail_);
00234     // Then push it in
00235     _InsertIntoNode(theNode, theNode->count, value);
00236   }
00237 }

00239 /**************************************************************************/
00248 /**************************************************************************/
00249 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00250 void BList<T, Size>::push_front(const T& value) throw(BListException)
00251 {
00252   // Welp, it ain't sorted anymore
00253   _isSorted = false;
00254   // If no head, its an empty list, just add it in
00255   if (head_ == NULL)
00256   {
00257     // Create the node
00258     BNode* newNode = _CreateNode();
00259     // Add in the value
00260     _InsertIntoNode(newNode, 0, value);
00261     // And just set it as the head and the tail
00262     head_ = newNode; tail_ = newNode;
00263   }
00264   // If there is a head, see whether you can push it in there
00265   else
00266   {
00267     BNode* theNode = head_;
00268     // if it is a full node, add in a new node first
00269     if (head_->count == Size) theNode = _CreateNode(head_, NULL);
00270     // Then push it in
00271     _InsertIntoNode(theNode, 0, value);
00272   }
00273 }

00275 /**************************************************************************/
00284 /**************************************************************************/
00285 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00286 void BList<T, Size>::insert(const T& value) throw(BListException)
00287 {
00288   // Start from the head
00289   BNode* theNode = head_;
00290   // If it is an empty list, just add it in and stuff it there
00291   if (theNode == NULL){ push_back(value); return; }
00292   // Store the previous node
00293   BNode* prevNode = NULL;
00294   // Find the first node which has a head value larger than value
00295   while (theNode && theNode->values[0] < value){
00296     prevNode = theNode;
00297     theNode = theNode->next;
00298   }
00299   // If there is a previous, grab the previous one (because you will add there)
00300   if (prevNode) theNode = prevNode;
00301   // Find the first position in the array which has a larger value
00302   unsigned thePos = 0;
00303   while (thePos != theNode->count && theNode->values[thePos] < value) ++thePos;
00304   // If there isn't space in the node, split the node into two first
00305   if (theNode->count >= Size){
00306     unsigned theSize = Size;
00307     // Ensure it is not the special case Size ==1
00308     if (theSize != 1){
00309       // First, check to see whether there is any space in the next node
00310       if (thePos >= theNode->count&&theNode->next && theNode->next->count<Size){
00311         // if there is, just use that instead
00312         // Reduce the pos and go to the newly splitted node
00313         thePos -= theNode->count; theNode = theNode->next;
00314       }
00315       // No space, just split
00316       else{
00317         // Split the node
00318         theNode = _SplitNode(theNode);
00319         // If the pos is more than the first one, use the new node
00320         if (thePos > theNode->count){
00321           // Reduce the pos and go to the newly splitted node
00322           thePos -= theNode->count; theNode = theNode->next;
00323         }
00324       }
00325     }
00326     // If it is, add a node in front or behind based on the value
00327     else{
00328       // The new node
00329       BNode* newNode;
00330       // If the value is less, add a node to the back and put it there
00331       if (thePos == 1) newNode = _CreateNode(theNode->next, theNode);
00332       // if not, add a node to the front and put it there
00333       else newNode = _CreateNode(theNode, theNode->prev);
00334       // Then put it there
00335       theNode = newNode; thePos = 0;
00336     }
00337   }// Then stuff it into the appropriate node
00338   _InsertIntoNode(theNode, thePos, value);
00339 }

00341 /**************************************************************************/
00349 /**************************************************************************/
00350 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00351 void BList<T, Size>::remove(int index) throw(BListException)
00352 {
00353   // If the index is more than the ItemCount, throw exception
00354   if (index >= static_cast<int>(_stats.ItemCount) || index < 0) 
00355   throw(BListException(BListException::E_BAD_INDEX, "Index is out of bounds!"));
00356   // Go to the appropriate node
00357   BNode* theNode = head_;
00358   while (theNode && index >= static_cast<int>(theNode->count)){
00359     // Decrement the index by the node's size
00360     index -= theNode->count;
00361     // Go to the next node
00362     theNode = theNode->next;
00363   }
00364   // Then use that node for removing
00365   _RemoveFromNode(theNode, static_cast<size_t>(index));
00366 }

00368 /**************************************************************************/
00376 /**************************************************************************/
00377 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00378 void BList<T, Size>::remove_by_value(const T& value)
00379 {
00380   // Find the value
00381   int thePos = find(value);
00382   // If it is not negative, remove it
00383   if (thePos >= 0) remove(thePos);
00384 }

00386 /**************************************************************************/
00397 /**************************************************************************/
00398 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00399 int BList<T, Size>::find(const T& value) const
00400 {
00401   // If the list is empty, return -1
00402   if (!head_) return -1;
00403   // Start from the head
00404   BNode* theNode = head_;
00405   int currentPos = 0;
00406   // If it is sorted, look for the appropriate node
00407   if (_isSorted){
00408     // store previous node
00409     BNode* prevNode = NULL;
00410     // Find the first node which has a head value larger than value
00411     while (theNode && (theNode->values[0] < value||theNode->values[0] == value))
00412     {
00413       prevNode = theNode;
00414       // Increment the current pos by the node's size
00415       currentPos += theNode->count;
00416       // Go to the next node
00417       theNode = theNode->next;
00418     }
00419     // If there is no previous, you are accessing the first, itsa cool
00420     // If there is, grab the previous one
00421     if (prevNode) theNode = prevNode;
00422     // Use the node to look
00423     return currentPos - theNode->count + _FindInNode(theNode, value);
00424   }
00425   // if it is not, just go through all elements
00426   else{
00427     // Go through each node
00428     int foundPos = -1;
00429     while (theNode){
00430       // Increment the current pos by the node's size
00431       currentPos += theNode->count;
00432       // See whether you could find it
00433       foundPos = _FindInNode(theNode, value);
00434     // If you could find it, return
00435     if (foundPos != -1) break;
00436       // Go to the next node
00437       theNode = theNode->next;
00438     }
00439     // if it couldn't find it, just return -1
00440     if (foundPos == -1) return -1;
00441     // if it could find something, return it
00442     return currentPos - theNode->count + foundPos;
00443   }
00444 }

00459 T& BList<T, Size>::operator[](int index) throw(BListException)
00460 {
00461   // use the const version for this
00462   return const_cast<T&>(const_cast<const BList<T,Size>&>(*this)[index]);
00463 }

00465 /**************************************************************************/
00476 /**************************************************************************/
00477 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00478 const T& BList<T, Size>::operator[](int index) const throw(BListException)
00479 {
00480   // If the index is out of boundaries, throw exception
00481   if (index < 0 || static_cast<unsigned>(index) >= _stats.ItemCount) 
00482   throw(BListException(BListException::E_BAD_INDEX, "Index is out of bounds!"));
00483   // Keep jumping through the nodes until your index is less than the count
00484   BNode* theNode = head_;
00485   while (static_cast<unsigned>(index) >= theNode->count)
00486   {
00487     // Reduce the index
00488     index -= theNode->count;
00489     // Go to next node
00490     theNode = theNode->next;
00491   }
00492   // Found the node that you belong to, grab that one
00493   return theNode->values[index];
00494 }

00507 {

00509   return _stats.ItemCount;

00512 /**************************************************************************/
00517 /**************************************************************************/
00518 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00519 void BList<T, Size>::clear(void)
00520 {
00521   // Go through all the nodes, deleting all of them
00522   while (head_) _DeleteNode(head_);
00523   // And set your stats to 0
00524   _stats.ItemCount = 0;
00525   _stats.NodeCount = 0;
00526 }

00562 /**************************************************************************/
00576 /**************************************************************************/
00577 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00578 typename BList<T, Size>::BNode* BList<T, Size>::_CreateNode(BNode* afterNode, 
00579                                                             BNode* beforeNode) 
00580                                                            throw(BListException)
00581 {
00582   // The new node
00583   BNode* newNode;
00584   // Try to allocate for a new node
00585   try{ newNode = new BNode(); }
00586   // Problem allocation, throw another exception
00587   catch (std::bad_alloc& ba)
00588   { throw(BListException(BListException::E_NO_MEMORY, ba.what())); }
00589   // Set the values to invalid
00590   for (unsigned i = 0; i < Size; ++i) newNode->values[i] = T();
00591   // If there is no node before that, its at the start of the list
00592   if (beforeNode == NULL)
00593   {
00594     // Make the head be the next of the newNode
00595     newNode->next = head_;
00596     if (head_) head_->prev = newNode;
00597     // Update the head
00598     head_ = newNode;
00599   }
00600   // If not, then set it as the next
00601   else
00602   {
00603     // Set before to point to this next
00604     beforeNode->next = newNode;
00605     // Set newNode to opint to this prev
00606     newNode->prev = beforeNode;
00607   }
00608   // If there is no node after that, its at the end of the list
00609   if (afterNode == NULL)
00610   {
00611     // Make the tail be the prev of the newNode
00612     newNode->prev = tail_; 
00613     if (tail_) tail_->next = newNode;
00614     // Update the tail
00615     tail_ = newNode;
00616   }
00617   // If not, set it as the previous
00618   else
00619   {
00620     // Set after to point to this as prev
00621     afterNode->prev = newNode;
00622     // set newNode to point to this as next
00623     newNode->next = afterNode;
00624   }
00625   // INcrement the count
00626   ++_stats.NodeCount;
00627   // Then return it
00628   return newNode;
00629 }
00630 
00631 /**************************************************************************/
00639 /**************************************************************************/
00640 // Removes a node (delete)
00641 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00642 void BList<T, Size>::_DeleteNode(BNode* theNode)
00643 {
00644   // If there is a prev, set it to point to the next
00645   if (theNode->prev) theNode->prev->next = theNode->next;
00646   // if there isn't, its at the start, set the next as the first
00647   else head_ = theNode->next;
00648   // if it has a next, update next's prev
00649   if (theNode->next) theNode->next->prev = theNode->prev;
00650   // If there isn't, its at the end, update the tail
00651   else tail_ = theNode->prev;
00652   // Decrement the count
00653   --_stats.NodeCount;
00654   // Then just delete it
00655   delete theNode;
00656 }
00657 
00658 /**************************************************************************/
00670 /**************************************************************************/
00671 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00672 void BList<T, Size>::_InsertIntoNode(BNode* theNode, 
00673                                       size_t pos, 
00674                                       const T& theElem)
00675 {
00676   // Go through the elements from the back, moving each of them front by 1
00677   for (unsigned i = theNode->count; i > pos; --i)
00678   {
00679     //std::cout << "Moving " << i << " backwards: " << pos << std::endl;
00680     theNode->values[i] = theNode->values[i-1];
00681   }
00682   // Then put the new elem in the first position
00683   theNode->values[pos] = theElem;
00684   // INcremnt the count
00685   ++theNode->count;
00686   ++_stats.ItemCount;
00687 }
00688 
00689 /**************************************************************************/
00699 /**************************************************************************/
00700 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00701 void BList<T, Size>::_RemoveFromNode(BNode* theNode, 
00702                                      size_t pos)
00703 {
00704   // Go through the elements from the position, moving them back by 1
00705   for (size_t i = pos; i < (theNode->count-1); ++i)
00706   {
00707     theNode->values[i] = theNode->values[i+1];
00708   }
00709   // Then null out the last element
00710   theNode->values[theNode->count-1] = T();
00711   // Decremnt the count
00712   --theNode->count;
00713   --_stats.ItemCount;
00714   // If the node is now empty, delete the node as well
00715   if (theNode->count == 0) _DeleteNode(theNode);
00716 }
00717 
00718 /**************************************************************************/
00730 /**************************************************************************/
00731 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00732 typename BList<T, Size>::BNode* BList<T, Size>::_SplitNode(
00733                                         BNode* theNode)
00734 {
00735   // Create a new node
00736   BNode* newNode = _CreateNode(theNode->next, theNode);
00737   // Copy over the second half of the values and null yourself
00738   for (int i = Size / 2; i < Size; ++i)
00739   {
00740     // Insert it to the back of the new node
00741     _InsertIntoNode(newNode, newNode->count, theNode->values[i]);
00742     // null out yourself
00743     theNode->values[i] = T();
00744     // And decrement the count
00745     --theNode->count;
00746     --_stats.ItemCount;
00747   }
00748   
00749   // Return the original node
00750   return theNode;
00751 }

00753 /**************************************************************************/
00767 /**************************************************************************/
00768 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00769 int BList<T, Size>::_FindInNode(BNode* theNode, 
00770                                 const T& theVal) const
00771 {
00772   // If it is sorted, call binarysearch
00773   if (_isSorted) return _BinarySearch(theNode, theVal);
00774   // If not, call linearsearch
00775   else return _LinearSearch(theNode, theVal);
00776 }
00777 
00778 /**************************************************************************/
00792 /**************************************************************************/
00793 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00794 int BList<T, Size>::_LinearSearch(BNode* theNode, 
00795                                   const T& valToSearch) const
00796 {
00797   // Just go through the entire thing until you find it
00798   int thePos = 0;
00799   while (thePos < static_cast<int>(theNode->count) && 
00800           !(theNode->values[thePos] == valToSearch)) ++thePos;
00801   // If it failed, return -1
00802   if (thePos == static_cast<int>(theNode->count)) return -1;
00803   // If not, return the position
00804   return thePos;
00805 }
00806 
00807 /**************************************************************************/
00821 /**************************************************************************/
00822 template <typename T, unsigned Size>
00823 int BList<T, Size>::_BinarySearch(BNode* theNode, 
00824                                   const T& valToSearch) const
00825 {
00826   // Start from the middle
00827   int thePos = theNode->count/2;
00828   // The starting size of the subarray
00829   int subSize = theNode->count/2;
00830   // Keep iterating until you find it
00831   while (!(theNode->values[thePos] == valToSearch) && subSize != 0)
00832   {
00833     // If it is more than, move to the left
00834     if (valToSearch < theNode->values[thePos]) thePos -= subSize/2;
00835     // If it is less than, move to the right
00836     else if (theNode->values[thePos] < valToSearch) thePos += subSize/2;
00837     // Cut subSize by half and round it if it is not 1
00838     if (subSize != 1) subSize = RoundFloat(static_cast<float>(subSize)/2.0f);
00839     // If it is one, you're done
00840     else subSize = 0;
00841   }
00842   // If the value at the pos is the val to search, you're done
00843   if (theNode->values[thePos] == valToSearch) return thePos;
00844   // If not, you failed, return -1
00845   return -1;
00846 }
